episodeTitle: Angry Finale! Cross the Red Line!
episodeTitleJapanese: 怒りの決着！赤い大陸（レッドライン）を乗り越えろ！
episodeTitleRomanized: Ikari no Ketchaku! Reddo Rain o Norikoero!
description: The Warship Island Arc concludes as Luffy defeats Eric at Reverse Mountain. Apis chooses to stay behind to protect the Dragon's Nest, and the Straw Hat crew successfully navigates the treacherous currents to enter the Grand Line.

events.title: Final Confrontation with Eric Begins
events.description: After departing Warship Island, the Straw Hats face Eric one final time near Reverse Mountain. Eric proposes they join forces to obtain Dragonite for eternal life, but the crew refuses his offer.
events.significance: Sets up the final battle of the Warship Island Arc and demonstrates the crew's moral integrity in refusing Eric's corrupt offer.

quotes.text: Join me and we can obtain the Dragonite together! We could have eternal life!
quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.context: Eric tries to recruit the Straw Hats to his cause

events.title: Eric Betrays Nelson
events.description: After Nelson's defeat, Eric swiftly attacks and slashes his former employer, revealing that he planned all along to monopolize the dragon bone elixir for himself rather than share it with Nelson.
events.significance: Demonstrates Eric's true villainous nature and his complete lack of loyalty, establishing him as the arc's primary antagonist rather than just a henchman.

events.title: Eric's Ultimate Attack: Kama Kama no Kamaitachi Midareuchi
events.description: Eric unleashes his ultimate technique, slashing many times to release multiple air blades followed by a powerful whirlwind of razor air that can effortlessly slice through solid rock. Usopp quickly reacts to save Apis from the attack.
events.significance: Showcases the full extent of Eric's Kama Kama no Mi Devil Fruit powers before his defeat.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.context: Eric's ultimate attack aimed at Apis

events.title: Luffy Defeats Eric
events.description: Luffy engages Eric in combat and decisively defeats him using his Devil Fruit techniques including Gomu Gomu no Pistol and Gomu Gomu no Kane, sending Eric flying off into the distance.
events.significance: Marks the defeat of the Warship Island Arc's main antagonist and demonstrates Luffy's growth as a fighter.

events.title: Nami Outsmarts Eric
events.description: As Eric attempts one final attack, Nami cleverly warns him about Dragonite being beside him. Eric falls for the trap, and Nami kicks his leg, causing him to fall into the treacherous currents near Reverse Mountain.
events.significance: Showcases Nami's intelligence and quick thinking, permanently removing the threat of Eric and demonstrating her value as a strategist.

events.title: Reverse Mountain Debut
events.description: The Straw Hats arrive at Reverse Mountain, an extremely tall mountain on the Red Line where four rivers from the Blues flow upward and converge into a fifth canal descending into the Grand Line. The location serves as the official gateway to the Grand Line.
events.significance: Marks a major milestone in the Straw Hats' journey as they reach the entrance to the Grand Line. This location is central to the series' world geography and represents the beginning of their true adventure.

quotes.text: That's Reverse Mountain! The entrance to the Grand Line!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami explains the significance of the location to the crew

events.title: Apis Chooses to Stay on Warship Island
events.description: Apis makes the bittersweet decision to remain on Warship Island to protect the Dragon's Nest rather than join the Straw Hat crew on their journey to the Grand Line. The crew says farewell to their new friend.
events.significance: Provides closure to Apis's character arc and demonstrates her growth and commitment to protecting the dragons and her home. Shows that not all allies will join the crew permanently.

events.title: Entering the Grand Line
events.description: The Going Merry successfully navigates the treacherous upward-flowing currents of Reverse Mountain with Nami's expert navigation. The crew celebrates as they cross over the peak and descend into the Grand Line, marking the official beginning of their grand adventure.
events.significance: This is a pivotal moment in the entire One Piece series - the moment the Straw Hats officially enter the Grand Line and begin their true journey toward finding the One Piece. It represents the transition from the East Blue Saga to the greater adventures ahead.

quotes.text: We're going to the Grand Line! The adventure begins now!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excitement as they enter the Grand Line

events.title: Crew Members' Wishes for the Grand Line
events.description: As they cross into the Grand Line, the crew members (except Luffy) each think about their wishes and dreams for this new journey - Zoro seeking to become the world's greatest swordsman, Nami to map the world, Usopp to become a brave warrior, and Sanji to find All Blue.
events.significance: Reinforces each crew member's individual dreams and motivations as they embark on their Grand Line journey, reminding viewers of what drives each character.

quotes.text: That's Reverse Mountain! The entrance to the Grand Line!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Explaining Reverse Mountain to the crew

quotes.text: We're going to the Grand Line! The adventure begins now!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Celebrating their entry into the Grand Line

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Defeating Eric in their final battle

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the crew members' individual dreams as they enter the Grand Line, each motivated by their personal goals and ambitions.
themes.symbolism: Reverse Mountain represents the physical barrier between ordinary seas and the dangerous Grand Line, symbolizing the crew's transition from small-time pirates to serious adventurers.

themes.description: Apis's decision to stay on Warship Island, while bittersweet, shows her dedication to protecting what she loves. The crew respects her choice, demonstrating the bonds they formed.
themes.symbolism: The farewell represents that not all friends can join the journey, but meaningful connections remain.

themes.description: The episode marks the end of the East Blue Saga and the beginning of the crew's Grand Line adventures, representing a major turning point in their journey.
themes.symbolism: Crossing Reverse Mountain symbolizes crossing the threshold from the known to the unknown, from safety to danger, from preparation to action.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Warship Island Arc is anime-original filler. In the manga, the Straw Hats go directly from Loguetown to Reverse Mountain without the Apis storyline.
The battle with Eric and the resolution of the Warship Island story are anime-only content. The manga proceeds directly to the crew's arrival at Reverse Mountain.
The second half of the episode (Reverse Mountain arrival) corresponds to Chapter 101 pages 2-4 and 11-19 of the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode of the Warship Island Arc, which is the first filler arc in One Piece. Eiichiro Oda, the manga creator, praised this arc in an early February issue of Weekly Shonen Jump.

sources.title: Warship Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This is the last episode to use 'RUN! RUN! RUN!' by Maki Otsuki as the ending theme, which had been used since Episode 31.
The 4Kids English adaptation combined Japanese episodes 61, 62, and 64 into a single episode titled 'Fantastic Voyage' (4Kids Episode 44), significantly altering the pacing and content.
Reverse Mountain's debut in this episode marks one of the most significant geographical locations in One Piece, serving as the primary entrance to the Grand Line for pirates from the four Blues.
Ryūsei Nakao, who voices Eric in Japanese, is famous for voicing Frieza in Dragon Ball Z. Kenny Green voices Eric in the Funimation English dub.
